result.execSummary:
The defendant Ameera M Mahfouz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 1 day was granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $194.00 to be paid to Sports Authority as a condition of probation.
Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No contact with Sports Authority listed in Criminal Complaint.
Must not be convicted of any further criminal violations or ordinances.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ameera M Mahfouz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Probation extended for 1 additional year due to unpaid obligations until 3/21/2018.
2/16/17 request from Probation & Parole for Extension of Probation

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ameera M Mahfouz in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of: Count #1. 

60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 day).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Sports Authority listed in Criminal Complaint. 
Must not be convicted of any further criminal violations or ordinances.  
Restitution: $194.00 to be paid to Sports Authority as a condition of probation
COSTS:  $253.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court.   Defendant Ameera M Mahfouz did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant Ameera M Mahfouz in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with store or any witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Ameera M Mahfouz in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Ameera M Mahfouz not in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
